name: The region for <City> should be <Region>

testSteps.description: 1: The region for London should be Europe ({City=London, Region=Europe, Region Code=EUR})

children.description: When points are calculated for a flight to or from London
Then the city should be considered to be part of the EUR region

testSteps.description: 2: The region for Sydney should be Australia/New Zealand ({City=Sydney, Region=Australia/New Zealand, Region Code=ANZ})

children.description: When points are calculated for a flight to or from Sydney
Then the city should be considered to be part of the ANZ region

testSteps.description: 3: The region for Los Angeles should be America ({City=Los Angeles, Region=America, Region Code=AMERICA})

children.description: When points are calculated for a flight to or from Los Angeles
Then the city should be considered to be part of the AMERICA region

testSteps.description: 4: The region for Buenos Aires should be America ({City=Buenos Aires, Region=America, Region Code=AMERICA})

children.description: When points are calculated for a flight to or from Buenos Aires
Then the city should be considered to be part of the AMERICA region

testSteps.description: 5: The region for Seoul should be Asia ({City=Seoul, Region=Asia, Region Code=ASIA})

children.description: When points are calculated for a flight to or from Seoul
Then the city should be considered to be part of the ASIA region

userStory.narrative:
Frequent Flyers earn status points each time they fly.
  As they earn more points, their status level increases and they get more benefits.

title: The region for <City> should be <Region>

rule.name: Cities are located in one of four regions for the purposes of point calculations
rule.description:
The four regions are:
  - Europe
  - Americas
  - Australia/New Zealand (ANZ)
  - Asia

dataTable.scenarioOutline:
When points are calculated for a flight to or from <City>
Then the city should be considered to be part of the <Region Code> region
